item.title: Keychron Linux Function Keys
item.description: When I bought a Keychron K2 I knew it work in Windows ans Mac, but I use Linux. But it’s just a keyboard… it will work. Well… It’s work! But on my OS Arch Linux with Gnome had a little problem. The FN keys didn’t work perfectly. Actually the FN keys were of MacOS, not Windows. How I fixed: Use the switch on side of keyboard to change to Windows mode Hold Fn + X + L for 4 seconds to set the key row to Function mode Type in the terminal:

item.title: Hello World!
item.description: Hello, friend. How are you? I’m fine and I expect that you are fine too. So… this is my blog! ðŸŽ‰ðŸŽ‰ðŸŽ‰ Yep! You are in it. I hope that you will have good moments and nice readings here. About what I’ll write? Hmmm… about everything, I think. You can hope technologies, histories from how I learn something. Example: sometimes I have a trouble in my Linux and I search all over the internet to find a solution.
